title.native: 理系が恋に落ちたので証明してみた。
title.romaji: Rikei ga Koi ni Ochita no de Shoumei shitemita.
title.english: Science Fell in Love, So I Tried to Prove It

description:
Yukimura Shinya, and Himuro Ayame are two scientists that want to find out if love can be solved by a scientific theory. These two scientists also have feelings for each other and want to be able to solve their true feelings through similar theoretical facts. With this perfect opportunity, these scientists will attempt to solve the theory of the love they express for each other.

Note: All episodes premiered on Amazon on January 11, 2020 but aired weekly on TV.
synonyms: 理科生坠入情网，故尝试证明。
พิสูจน์นิยามความรักด้วยหลักวิชาสายวิทย์

node.description: **Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

__[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100003558003913)__

__Residency:__ Fujisawa, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kugenuma High School, Yoyogi Animation Academy

__Aiko Matsuyama__ is a Japanese color designer and digital painter, who mainly does finishing.

__Height:__ 160 cm

[Website](http://www.amamiyasora.jp/) | [Profile](http://musicrayn.com/amamiya_sora) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/amamiyasorablog/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCc4xpujLxnUBSI1XX-SdldQ) | [Second YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2oaLFNojVzLwQaA5KJOy3g) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Amamiyastaff) 

While a sophomore in high school, Amamiya was introduced to a video collection of roles of voice actress [Miyuki Sawashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/95099). Following this, Amamiya decided to become a voice actress.

Amamiya, together with [Momo Asakura](https://anilist.co/staff/118479) and [Shiina Natsukawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118818), passed an audition held by Music Ray'n in 2011, with the three making their voice acting debut in 2012. She made her official music debut for Music Ray'n by performing Akame ga Kill's opening theme "Skyreach." In late 2014, Amamiya, Asakura, and Natsukawa formed the music unit [TrySail](https://anilist.co/staff/144938/), which released its first single "Youthful Dreamer," used as the opening theme to the anime television series Ultimate Otaku Teacher, on May 13, 2015.

Amamiya, together with [Reina Ueda](https://anilist.co/staff/118602) and [Aya Suzaki](https://anilist.co/staff/114834), received the Best New Actress award at the 9th Seiyu Awards in March 2015.

__Height:__ 168 cm
__Likes:__ Winter, Video Games, Blobfish, Cats, Beef, Ramen, Cheesecake
__Dislikes:__ Summer, Corn
__Favorite Artists:__ [BUMP OF CHICKEN](https://anilist.co/staff/109225/BUMP-OF-CHICKEN), [ONE OK ROCK](https://anilist.co/staff/126954/One-Ok-Rock), [Sekai no Owari](https://anilist.co/staff/121606/Sekai-no-Owari), [YUI](https://anilist.co/staff/100287/Yui), [DOES](https://anilist.co/staff/104260/DOES) and [Porno Graffitti](https://anilist.co/staff/102716/Porno-Graffitti)

__[Website](https://sou-official.jp/)__ | __[Profile (Universal Music Japan)](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/sou/biography/)__  | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nico_nico_sou)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLAhLxCcqi5afnNTQNnfX-g)__

__Introduction:__
Sou is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist under record label Universal Music Japan (2019-), having previously been under EXIT TUNES (2015-2016) and Saihate Records (2016-2019). Prior to 2015, he was to perform as an utaite on the site Nico Nico Douga.

__Biography:__
On October 2013, he started performing as a singer on the video uploading site Nico Nico Douga. He was only 15 years old at the time. Two years later on December 2, 2015, he made his major debut with the release of his first album titled "[Suisou Regulus](https://open.spotify.com/album/1shHHMbW5b08I9HZTPIeMY)" through the record label EXIT TUNES.

After his major debut in 2015, he would release other works in collaboration with other utaite such as Nayutan, [Harumaki Gohan](https://twitter.com/harumaki_gohan) and [Eve](https://anilist.co/staff/132869/Eve), while also forming and participating in music unit "[Okaeritte Ie](https://utaite.fandom.com/wiki/Category:Okaeritte_Ie)" with utaite Wolpis Carter and Isubokuro. As of July 2019, he has accumulated over 4.5 million views on his cover of Eve's song titled "Literary Nonsense", and 13 million views on his cover of Chouchou-P's song titled "Kokoronashi". Both becoming quite popular through the tides of time.

On March 2019, he released his first song "Parade of Fools", which he himself wrote and composed, while on May of the same year, he made his first one-man live performance with "Salir" at the Akasaka Blitz in Tokyo, Japan.

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou), edited | [Fandom (Utaite)](https://utaite.fandom.com/wiki/Sou), edited)

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/andrerinaldidub/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/andrerinaldidub) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/andrerinaldidub) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@andrerinaldidub) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJB9-DmISWwZaBMmDqK7i2A) | [Site Web](https://www.andrerinaldi.com)

André Augusto Rinaldi is a Brazilian actor, voice actor and dubbing director. He currently directs at Grupo Macias and at DuBrasil. He is the cousin of the voice actor [Fabricio Rinaldi](https://anilist.co/staff/209058/).

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/bruno_casemiro/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bruno_casemiro) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/bruno.casemiro)

Bruno Casemiro is an Brazilian actor, voice actor, commercial announcer and producer active in the São Paulo region. He gained prominence after winning the Quero Ser Dublador (translated to "I Want to be a Voice Actor") contest held by the DuBrasil studio.
